WRITING.TITLE: Arcade 1up tmolding?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey everyone! I saw someone here had posted an area 51 can build here recently, just curious if anyone knew where to get green t molding for control panels ? What size is it for the standard arcade 1up trim?

WRITING.TITLE: Modded my Marvel SE cab with pi4. At 1750 and 620 area 51 playability is perfect.

WRITING.TEXT: im waiting for the sinden lightgun, however right now im testing out a dolphin mayflash bar with a wii remote with a black wii gun. Seems to be working pretty good. I wont be doing this one as a shooter but im doing an area 51 cab with both a pi4 and a wii for house of the dead/a51+ others. Im doing it on a tmnt cab because of the green trim. Ill post pics when its completed

yeah you sure can. Its my 2nd one. They make them at DIY arcade its like 21 bucks with shipping. And there are options if you want speakers. This time i did logitech speakers with a subwoofer/amp so i went that route. Or you could just use a 30mm holesaw bit on a drill
yeah i did 2 with recoil. with as popular as they are we probably wouldnt even get them for at least a year otherwise

the power and volume switch you could probably get pinned to the pi but you have to write script to get those to work. Im working to get my power switch wired to a switching power brick, so itll turn everything back on after shutdown. You can actually reuse all your old buttons, however youll run into problems with the joystick because its a 2 piece cable essentially. Youll either need a different 5 pin ribbon cable or switch the joystick so itll work with the encoders. I used a pi image already made. It has 2 games i wanted. mvc2 and area 51/max force. Im building an a51 cab, so ill be looking for a lightgun image
it is!
Appreciate it! I just wanted to to match the oem theme
sure thing! I learned a lot from my previous build, anytime
thats pretty cool i didnt even know house of the dead 2 could play on pi4. Im building a cab with a wii and wii pistols just for that game
check out youtube, someone just posted mvc2 sweet spot #s and did frame rate comparisons. I think he had arm 1950, core 750, overvolt 4, v3d 750
I did notice the slight dip, ill probably play with the numbers a bit until I get it right
naomi

I dont know if the pi4 pinout is the same as the pi3, i went a different route. I wired my switch to a power brick with a relay so when i power down the pi switch it off and everything goes with it. I tried wiring up a pi3 to make everything work, to me adding the script was more of a pain than it was worth.To each their own but I wanted to keep it simple. Some people have even wired a standalone switch to a regular power strip and had good success with that.
Those coin buttons are awesome!
Good luck! Its not as bad as you think it is just to get rolling.
yeah i can take some, its still a rats nest fyi lol

easy. Heres what you need https://www.bc-robotics.com/shop/iot-power-relay/ Plug your strip into that, wire your switch in, obviously youll need to extend your wires, or depends on where you mount it. Theres a youtube video on it demonstrating it
yeah ill post it after work
https://youtu.be/O1EkuwaNOJ0
This is the best video ive found on it. You can run wire from your switch to it, and plug in your power strip to it.

When I modded mine I got a kit that included sanwya sticks. They were a bolt in deal no drilling or modding required. If you reuse your original sticks you will need to find a 5 pin cable to be able to pin it to an encoder if you go the pi route. The only other thing I did was went with a pi4, so Just ordered buttons, joysticks, encoders, wiring, and video converter
https://www.reddit.com/r/Arcade1Up/comments/hlnwij/modded_my_marvel_se_cab_with_pi4_at_1750_and_620/?utm_medium=android_app amp;utm_source=share this is mine
https://www.diyretroarcade.com/products/speaker-grill-panel-for-arcade1up-for-two-4-inch-speakers-with-2-extra-holes

https://www.bonanza.com/listings/Arcade1up-Mod-kit/814404284 This seller is great. You can ask for most combination of buttons, has the lcd controller, amp, all wiring, joysticks etc. You can get the top kit that has a pi 3+, i decided to go with a pi4 so I had to do the pi seperate
Dystlovs Pass!
My wifes Aunt lives there, they got hit pretty hard, alot of their population is elderly and most who got it died. Its pretty sad

Check out my post I just modded my Marvel cab. The config you need to have a controller plugged in to get to the config screen. Then select your up down left etc. The power button there is a solution without plugging things in tonyour pi or writting script. Wire your Switch to a switching power supply. See my post for info
what are you runnning? pi?

they make a 5 pin cable for that, youll need to do some research on it. This is the problem I had with my marvel, so i swapped to sanwas with the correct cable. You can order them online and its the same joystick, just different config. I reused the sleeve and black joystick bats to make it look original ( except for the led buttons)
Im building one with a wii, consider that as an option
or consider a pi4/mayflash dolphin bar/ wii remote
I have both on my pi4. Overclock to 1750, runs decent. flawless at 1950hz. and depending on the image it will have both the naomi and dreamcast versions (mvc2)

Overclocking is easy on the pi4, that was my initial concern. In the menu, you can actually select overclock and choose your parameters. My case has a fan so im comfortable running 1750hz. dependingnon the image you can go as high as 2000, but run a good fan. I chose the icetower fan, its like 20 bucks and you wont have to worry about overheat. I set mine at 1750 and its been played nonstop for 7 months, no problems
no keyboard or anything to type in, easy peasy. If you want to mess with the overvoltage parameters then you might, but im not concerned about it starving.

Some nfl blitz versions work on it better than others, playstation version is fine, n64 versions a little glitchy. I read somewhere the arcade rom of it actually plays really well. Im not sure what the image is, it was in a kit aquired on ebay. It probably is an arcade punks image. Do some research, but are saying great things about the wolfanoz image, i actually want get one because of the lightgun options.
Its got the 20 inch tulsa monitor, wii with house of the dead 2, working on gun holsters

thank you! i rolled with the t molding because of the zombie blood ( and it was a tmnt cab, so all i needed to add was a blank control panel.) I might sell it in the future, who knows! part sourcing was the biggest hassle
haha not a bad idea, not sure on another sega game, any suggestions? I pi4d my marvel se cab specifically for naomi ( mvc2)

no it works great, its mounted right underneath the marquee, right above the screen. i can take a pic and post it. its actually reccomended by nintendo to put it there on top of the screen. I also have a wireless one, someday ill play around with position.
I have a pi4 and i ran both, naomi runs better in my opinion. you try overclocking it to see if it was running slow,?

all overclocking is is increasing the clock rate on a cpu beyond factory spec. Factory i wanna say is 1600hz, mines set at 1750. Try the naomi version and see how it goes. itll play ok enough at factory settings, but to get those frames per second working flawless youll want to do that.
did you drill out your speaker panel or did you get it from somewhere? Check out my HOTD i did mine with green trim
Does it work any better mounted down below? nintendo has a post reccomending it above the screen
appreciate it!
is that tekknoparrot version?
solder them on, or buy car speakers, they have the wiring the prongs on them. Heres a hint : no lead free solder, its junk lol

I modded a Mk2 cab with a 3b+, and a marvel superheroes with a pi4. Trust me when i say this go with the 4, itll run a lot more demanding games. as far as the control deck, you have 2 options. either drill out the holes with what i believe is a 30mm hole saw, or some people will mod it for you. 80 or 90 bucks to have someone drill it and install the buttons. since both are 2 player, they both had the 6 button layout so no worries. all i did was buy a slide in j panel that has cuts for coin buttons and 4 inch speakers
fyi overclocked pi4 back in jan, still plays great, just get a case with a fan and your good
sure thing let me find the link

because the input from the raspberry 3 requires an hdmi, i dont think it really matters if you run it through vga or dvi, you have to have converter. dvi to hdmi is like 7 bucks

there has been a few youtube videos on it, one guy had it dialed in at 1950hz, 750mhz, vram 320 and overvolt... 6? Me personally I set it 1750hz and it seems to be the most reliable. Coming up close to.. 8 months of consistent playing with zero issues. I tried at 2000hz, but because my fan wasnt good enough, it kept freezing. Id reccomended an ice tower, its like 15 bucks i think
thats interesting i would maybe email them about it. I have a different image, menu overclock works just fine
theres also cases with a regular fan on it, not sure if it uses the same pins
tulsa does have a19inch kit, as long as its a nonwide and has 4:3 ratio it might be ok
ok, there us a video on youtube where someone stuffed a 19inch into the original wood bezel, look it up.
60 in 1 kit is a bit cheaper, and limits you to 60 classic games. A raspberry pi will give you 7 to 8000 games, the 3b is a solid cheaper choice. If you want more demanding games, try a pi 4

you want a really good option try bonanza. all buttons, encoders, amp, wiring, lcd board + pi3. i think it was 220.
after looking closely i see your riser is not matching.

what are you using? pi3? if so the on off switch can be wired to pins 5 and 6, then you will have to add script to accept a command from it. Or, just install an on off arcade switch on the back and dont worry about the switches

other than your current issue hows the setup for it? im interested in doing something similiar

i like the button choice, nice !
marvel, ive done both, the layout is just better all around for modding
Nice work! its awesome

You have a few options, you could do a 60 in 1 if all you want is classic games, you could do a pi3, which is a decent route and you can get the whole thing in s kit, or go with a pi4 which will handle more demanding games. Id also reccomend a 3/4 that has a horizontal screen, makes it easier. let us know if you have any questions

try a marvel or street fighter cab, they already have all the holes you need for buttons. just need to add coin buttions. you can change out a kickplate to have holes for thst as well as a way to mount speakers
this is true a 60 in 1 works well with vertical, however it can be a hassle with a pi sometimes. a horizontal monitor works well with all 3.
stand corrected this is true
the worlds got serious education problem, with the US being some of the dumbest

no you would not. vertical games do work on horizontal monitors with a pi3/pi4, and thats personal experience with both. A pi3 kit with everything you need is like 220 i believe, or you could piece it together yourself. ill turn on millipede/centipede in a bit and see if it works with a joystick
they both work with a joystick
try a marvel then, same easy layout
